Package cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner.util

Class FilesHandler

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner.util.FilesHandler
public class FilesHandler
extends java.lang.Object
The class which is responsible for files handling and creating, path computing and searching the required resources for correct program execution.

  • Method Details

    • findResource

      public static java.io.File findResource​(java.lang.String fileName)
      The method which searches for the resource file needed for the program to run correctly. The search starts in the default "resources" directory. If the resource is not found, then it searches in the project root and eventually in limited number of higher directories. This number is limited in order to avoid the AccessDeniedException caused by Files.walk(Path, FileVisitOption...) method. If the resource still can not found, then the exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the resource file to be searched for.
      Returns:
      The resource file, or null if it is not found.

    • walkThrough

      private static java.io.File walkThrough​(java.nio.file.Path path, java.lang.String fileName)
      Wrapper around file walking and collecting used findResource(String) method.
      Parameters:
      path - Represents the path where the fileName should be searched for.
      fileName - The fileName to be searched for while walking through the path.
      Returns:
      The file representing the found resource file, or null, when such a file could not be found or an error occurrs.

    • createNewFile

      public static java.io.File createNewFile​(java.lang.String pathName, java.lang.String fileName)
      Creates a new file in the user defined directory or in the default output directory.
      Parameters:
      pathName - Represents a desired path to store the file. This parameter may represent an absolute path as well as a relative path to the current project directory. If null or if the path is invalid, the default "output" directory of the project is used.
      fileName - Name of the new file.
      Returns:
      New file either in the specified directory or in the default project output directory.

    • pwd

      public static java.lang.String pwd()
      Returns:
      The String representing the current directory.
